attributes.action: Remove MFL as a mandatory subject and allow students to chose if they take MFL
attributes.background: Plenty of students time is wasted learning a modern foreign language they have no interest in learning. Students should be allowed to pick if they take Modern Foreign Languages. Students should chose spend in a subject they have no interest in rather than wasting money and time of schools.

attributes.action: To be able to get a vehicle privately removed if it is deemed an obstruction
attributes.background: The laws on obstruction of someone's property is limited! If a vehicle is obstructing entrance to your property, be it drive way/carport or land, make it possible for you to get it privately towed without having to get the police involved!

attributes.action: Introduce a trade embargo on Saudi Arabia
attributes.background: The Saudi state is notorious for its unjust and frankly disgusting treatment of women and LGBT people. It also massively restricts the civil liberties of its entire population. There is also evidence that suggests Saudi donors sponsor terrorism. We cannot support governments of this sort.
attributes.additional_details:
From gov.uk: 
"It’s illegal for women to drive."
"Homosexual acts and extra-marital sexual relations, including adultery, are illegal and can be subject to severe penalties."
"The Saudi legal system differs in many ways from the UK. Suspects can be held without charge"

A series of leaks from the then-Secretary of State Hillary Clinton's emails suggested that Saudi donors fund extremism.
A number of mosques found to be preaching extremist Wahhabism have been said to be linked to Saudi organisations.

attributes.action: reduce the brightness of vehicle emergency blue lights by half at night.
attributes.background: As a driver who works nights , I am regularly blinded by emergency vehicles using blue flashing lights. This causes a severe risk to other road users as my vehicle is a hgv that would cause mayhem if I lost control due to being blinded by these lights.

attributes.action: Ban farm machinery using the A55 during peak commuting hours
attributes.background: Slow-moving farm machinery is often causing delays during peak times for commuters. This has also often led to accidents causing lane/road closures and further/longer delays, as well as a drain on resources and a increased carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Set up an online registry for living organ donation
attributes.background: I recently called my regional transplant centre to donate a kidney and found that the process of ringing and finding information about living donation daunting and difficult. An online living donor registry with a pre-screening process could help encourage others to come forward and also save time.
attributes.additional_details:
I was told that it was unlikely to be able to due to being a young female (risks of renal failure during future pregnancy). A online registry with sufficient information could therefore save time as the medical professional had to explain the reasoning to me whilst simultaneously ensuring only those eligible come forward. 
From my perspective, there isn't enough education and awareness surrounding this topic and promoting living donation more may significantly help the many people in need

attributes.action: Require all pubs and clubs to have metal detectors
attributes.background: By making it a legal requirement to have metal detectors at the entrances of pubs and clubs we could prevent people from even carrying a knife on a night out; fear of it being found and leading to a criminal offence of carrying a deadly weapon.
attributes.additional_details: The security staff on pubs and clubs are there to protect customers and adhere to rules and policies of the venue –how can they protect someone from a knife if they are unaware of someone entering with a weapon of such.

attributes.action: Create"National Unity Day" UK-wide bank holiday to celebrate all that unites us.
attributes.background: We believe the United Kingdom needs a day that celebrates and promotes the fabric of what our great country was built upon - Unity. With our nation more divided than ever, we need a day that will bring us together to celebrate all that we have in common.
attributes.additional_details:
For more details visit:
www.Diversify.org

attributes.action: Make Northumberland Scottish land
attributes.background: I think that Scotland should rightfully own Northumberland. This is because Northumberland and Scotland share a similar culture and have strong ethnic ties. I believe this may help with the economy and natural resources as Northumberland has a lot of coal.
attributes.additional_details: Back in 2014/2015 many petitions were made for Northumberland to once again join Scotland. Many news articles reported on this. However, the people who signed those petitions did not get their wish. We have a shared history and culture. The UK Government in London doesn't govern Northumberland very well.

attributes.action: Make the motor trade require a licence to be a mechanic
attributes.background: The motor trade unlike all other trades doesn't require a licence for the tradesmen and women to work. Garages can employ anybody as a mechanic. Unlike plumbers for example who need licences to work. A licence would ensure mechanics are capable of doing the job to a reasonable standard and safely.

attributes.action: Allow under 40s to access their pension pot in order to buy their first house.
attributes.background: Young people are struggling to raise the funds to but their first home, yet they can have enough money for a deposit in their pension funds. The simplest solution being that younger people should be able to access their pension funds purely for use as a deposit for their first home.

attributes.action: Train fare increases should be frozen or capped at 1%
attributes.background: As a long suffering commuter I'm sick of paying out substantially increased fares each year with little noticeable improvement to services. Trains constantly break down, are over-crowded, or the issue is with Network Rail (meaning they get massively compensated but pay back very little to us)

attributes.action: Cut the "Aid budget" to other countries and use it to help our struggling NHS
attributes.background:
Our £13 Billion Aid budget needs to be cut for our struggling NHS. 
The NHS are struggling for staff, beds and resources to keep up with the growing demand. The NHS needs to be updated; with up to date systems/policies. 
Funding needs to be put into education, new staff and a important pay rise.
attributes.additional_details:
References- 

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/07/17/government-departments-struggling-spend-foreign-aid-budgets/amp/

attributes.action: Make promoting Paedophilia a criminal offence
attributes.background:
It's time for the UK Parliament to better protect and deliver justice for our children by proving to the British People that they believe Paedophilia to be abhorrent. 
Paedophilia has been promoted by speakers at a conference held at the University of Cambridge in 2013.

attributes.action: The council  to provide 24/7 childcare service to enable anyone access to work.
attributes.background: I am a single parent trying to do evening classes and work, however I am finding it impossible to access registered childcare after 6pm or weekends.  I have spoken with the head teachers in schools and they also agree that they all have many parents who don't have support,  nurses, or shift-workers.
attributes.additional_details:
Childcare could be provided by the council 24/7 and staff located in any area.  This means people can work in extended jobs and is important in many sectors of work.  The private childcare arrangements is not supportive and last minute emergencies is unobtainable. 
If the council provided help with limit of children and let the establishment grow then it will provide more work to qualified childcare support and enable parents to work and not be discriminated against as currently they are.

attributes.action: Make more council houses and flats
attributes.background: There are to many family's and single people suffering about not having homes we need to make sure that nobody should be homeless in this day and age families or people should feel safe
attributes.additional_details: I have spoken to people living on the streets also have seen to many programmes on this subject the government needs to take action

attributes.action: Stop councils charging for DIY waste at recycling sites.
attributes.background: The relevant government department has stated that these charges should not be imposed. Any discouragement to the proper disposal of DIY waste will contribute to the increase in fly tipping.

attributes.action: Increase pedestrian crossing times to enable disabled people to cross safely
attributes.background:
Often when I wait to cross the road and the green man appears, it goes off again whilst I'm only halfway through crossing - and I'm an able bodied person.

My father has MS and walks with a stick, meaning he and many other disabled people are not provided with enough time to safely cross the road.

attributes.action: Reinstate the funding for the Underground Maths project.
attributes.background: The Underground Maths website was the best resource available for teachers of A level Maths. The DfE recently stopped its funding. The removal of the funding means that it will no longer be developed, and it has been left incomplete. A level mathematics teaching in the UK will be poorer for it.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information, see these links. The Smith report is a government report on mathematics teaching that specifically endorses the Underground Maths project.

https://undergroundmathematics.org/ 

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/exclusive-dfe-abandons-flagship-maths-programme

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/smith-review-of-post-16-maths-report-and-government-response

attributes.action: Prescribe dance fitness classes on the NHS for everyone's good health
attributes.background: Classes like Zumba should be free and prescribed to everyone on the NHS as they provide multiple health benefits including losing weight and has been known to fight depression.

attributes.action: scrap 'smart' motorways and revert to a hard shoulder
attributes.background: So called 'smart' motorways are anything but smart . A small refuge that can barely accommodate an HGV . Cars do not breakdown always where there is a refuge available . There is no facility for cars/lorries to re-join at motorway speed . Cars breaking down in the 4th lane are sitting ducks .

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of time from 5 years to 3 for a divorce without consent.
attributes.background: You can divorce with their consent after 2 years separation but if they decide not to consent you then have to wait 5 years and you can divorce without their consent. 5 years is too long and more than double the 2 years with consent.

attributes.action: Ban the use of lead in all shotgun cartridges
attributes.background: The lead in shotgun cartridges is poisoning our environment. This leads to the slow death of many species of birds. Albeit shot birds that are consumed by predatory birds and scavengers or birds ingesting them mistakenly taken as grit. There are many alternatives available to use.

attributes.action: Prevent purchasers withdrawing from domestic property sales without consequence.
attributes.background: In England purchasers having had an offer accepted by the vendor are at liberty to withdraw from the transaction right up until contracts are exchanged without any cause. When this happens the vendors are usually unable to complete their purchase and left with significant nugatory costs to bear.

attributes.action: Raise the Minimum Wage for under 25s and apprentices
attributes.background: The Government's National Living Wage does not apply to those under the age of 25, who can be paid as little as £3.50 per hour if they are an apprentice or £4.05 otherwise.
attributes.additional_details:
It is an absolute scandal that this Tory government is forcing younger across the UK to live on poverty pay by refusing to give under 25s the basic protection of the National Living Wage.

This is an issue of fairness and equality. If you do the same job you should be paid at the same rate regardless of your age, and everyone should be paid at least the living wage so that they have enough money to feed themselves and cover the basics, like their rent and bills.

attributes.action: Requesting salary history to be made unlawful in the UK.
attributes.background:
Requesting salary history  as part of job selection process has to be made unlawful in the UK.This has been made a law in New York and other US states. So why not in the UK?

Being underpaid once shouldn't condemn you to a lifetime of inequality.
attributes.additional_details:
- A number of people are underpaid in the UK. Salary history should not be a factor in determining new pay as that undervalues the current market price for the position and skills of the employee.

- There is gender pay gap in the UK, and this will help bridge closing the gap. This is a well known issue in the UK which the government is tackling.

- Jobs will be offered based on skills, merit and demands of the job. Not gender, race or ethnicity.

attributes.action: Form a cross-party commission (national consensus) which negotiates Brexit
attributes.background:
I  think that the issue is too important, so we have to get it right. Such a Independent cross-party, all encapsulating approach will be formidable.
1. It will represent all of us 
2. it will show at the negotiations that; we mean Business! 
3. The whole nation will be behind it
attributes.additional_details:
When we and future generations look back at these historic times we can then at least know for sure that everyone took part and was represented in this monumental decision and effort of exiting the EU. And did it as seamlessly as possible.    

If we do not negotiate with national consensus the chances of us and the future generations resenting the actions that were taken will be inevitable.

eg. the IRAQ WAR and the Chilcott report

attributes.action: To make it easier for grandparents to get parental Responsibility
attributes.background: Fathers, same sex parents and step parents can get PR by downloading the form and taking it to the local court to be witnessed and signed and that’s it they have PR.
attributes.additional_details: Grandparents have to get mediation and then apply to the family court for permission to apply for a residence order or special guardianship order which can all take months. How can this be right over 200,000 grandparents are bringing up one of more of their grandchildren. I realise children have to be protected and made safe but making it this hard for grandparents to get PR is not doing this.

attributes.action: Make compassionate leave compulsory and paid
attributes.background: Make compassionate leave for close family members (parents, children, siblings, partners, in-laws and grandparents) compulsory for companies to recognize, and for the leave to be paid so the surviving family member is not left shortpaid due to the relatives death.
attributes.additional_details:
In May 2017, both of my grandfathers passed away. My company did not grant compassionate leave either time, giving me the only option to take it as unpaid sick leave. This pushed me into financial difficulty which I have yet to come out of, playing catch up each month. 

My cousin had the same situation, having to take annual leave on the day of our grandfathers death.

Family members dying is hard enough to deal with emotionally, the worker should not be affected financially as well.

attributes.action: Give Retained Firefighters the right to leave employment to respond to 999 calls
attributes.background: Retained Firefighters make up a majority of the fire stations across Norfolk. Retained FireFighters drop their responsibilities the second their alerters alarm. Heading towards the fire station to respond to a 999 emergency.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm appealing for the rights of these firemen to be able to leave their employment to respond to life changing 999 calls . 

I aim to make it a law that employers have to allow retained Firefighters to leave their workplace to respond to these fire calls .

attributes.action: Call on Boris Johnson to apologise immediately to Libya
attributes.background: Boris Johnson, the UK’s foreign secretary, is yet again finding himself in troubled water after making arguably racist remarks about another country. The fact that a foreign secretary can do this is baffling. He must apologise immediately - his views are NOT echoed by the UK people.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.com/news/amp/uk-politics-41490174

attributes.action: Amend building regulations to ban use of wooden/ laminate flooring in flats.
attributes.background:
Wooden and laminate floors in non-ground floor flats can make life very difficult for people living in flats below. The noise can be unbearable. 

Building regulations should be amended to ban the use of such flooring in non-ground floor flats.

attributes.action: Introduce a tourist tax in London - similar to the likes of New York and Naples.
attributes.background: Introducing a tourist tax would increase funds available in the capital for a whole range of issues - from tackling homelessness to improving existing infrastructure.

attributes.action: Move pedestrian crossing buttons further away from roadside for safety.
attributes.background: I believe that the position of 'Crossing Buttons' is too near the road. Children often run towards the button, wanting to be the one that presses it. A trip or stumble could easily result in them falling into the road or cause a motorist to swerve/brake etc. Bringing risk of accident or fatality.

attributes.action: Increase the Speed Limit on motorways between 11pm and 6am to 80 mph for cars.
attributes.background: During the night the motorway network is used less. Vehicles are now much better equipped with safety features to travel faster. Increasing the speed limit at night will encourage more travelling at this time and less congestion during the day. It would promote quicker and safer travelling at night.
attributes.additional_details: The National Speed Limit of 70mph on motorways was first introduced on a trial basis in 1965 and became permanent in 1967. The current 70mph limit has now been in place for over 50 years.

attributes.action: Make it impossible to claim benefits totalling more than the minimum wage
attributes.background:
Nobody on benefits should be able to claim more money per month than a person working full time in a minimum wage job.

How do we expect people to find work if they would be worse off working than on benefits.

Exceptions to this rule should only be made to disabled and elderly people.

attributes.action: Make Tv licences free for students studying Media and/or television.
attributes.background: Living in London and being a student is expensive. That, combined with the low maintenance loans, budgeting is a big part of being a student. Paying £147 a year to watch television, that is involved in our study, means a lot of people don't have access to this resource due to their budget.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of media students I have spoken to have also gone without a television licence which has affected their study. However, students are not willing to break the law and pay the £1000 fine, just to help improve their research and their grade.

attributes.action: Make teaching about tax and local politics compulsory in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Many people when they leave secondary school and college are thrown into the deep end of life and know nothing about the world they are entering into causing them to end up in debt or not even know how to pay bills.

attributes.action: Create a new public holiday for Indian new year's day
attributes.background: Show the British people that Government policies are truly representative of the the cultural diversity across our society. Diwali and Indian New Year mark an important time of the year for many different groups and we should mark this occasion with a public holiday.

attributes.action: Parents/carers of bullies should face jail time and/or a fine.
attributes.background: Children's suicide levels in the UK are on the rise and this is a direct result from being bullied. Bullying is a rampant problem in schools all across the UK, parents/carers need to take more responsibility for the actions of those in their care.
attributes.additional_details: In certain towns such as North Tonawand, New York have introduced laws where parents of bullies face a potential 15 days in prison or a $250 (£190) fine. The UK needs to follow suit in an attempt to resolve the ongoing problem that is bullying.

attributes.action: Cap Insurance Prices For People Under 25.
attributes.background: Insurance prices for young drivers is too high, often being in the thousands for a car that will only cost a few hundred pounds. Similar petitions have been started in the past but this one is different as I propose that a power cap is put on cars.
attributes.additional_details: My idea is to introduce a similar system to motorcycles and limit the power of cars young people can drive for 3 years after passing their test. A limit of 1600cc, this lowers the power that a young driver can have therefore meaning that they cannot have a car that is too powerful for them to control, insurance companies can then cap out insurance making it lower for all people as there are less powerful cars being driven by young drivers, making the roads safer for everyone in turn too.

attributes.action: The Government should buy Leonardo da Vinci's "Salvatore Mundi" for the nation
attributes.background: Painted by Leonardo at his best, fully authenticated, a snip at £75 million.
attributes.additional_details: If the French have " Mona Lisa", why can't we have "Salvatore Mundi"?

attributes.action: Nurses to work without having to pay an annual registration £120 fee to the NMC
attributes.background: I'm asking the government to support nurses not having to pay an annual registration fee to the NMC which is very costly . Nurses should be able to register without having to pay any fees .

attributes.action: Zero Rate all School Uniform for VAT regardless of size.
attributes.background: Children’s clothing is zero rated for VAT depending on size. But, larger school uniform is zero rated for children under 14 if it is unique to a school. No child can leave school before age 16, so this is unfair.  All customized school uniform, should be zero-rated, regardless of age.

attributes.action: Driving licence: Introduce mandatory re-training/re-examination every 5-10y
attributes.background: Driving tech, laws, training & examination changes/improves, as such, we should introduce mandatory re-skilling/examination to ensure all drivers are up to par also allowing removal of drivers from the road whom would not meet modern driving skill/knowlege requirements to make our roads safer.
attributes.additional_details: We live in an age where someone could have passed their test 50 years ago, and not have any of the modern driving skills or knowledge that is imparted onto modern drivers, all drivers should have to be kept "up to skill" to ensure they are safe road users.

attributes.action: Ban the use of farrowing crates in the UK
attributes.background: Farrowing crates, profoundly similar to sow crates which were banned in the UK in 1999, are long, narrow crates in which sows are contained during gestation. It's still legal to use farrowing crates in spite of them having the same implications to animal welfare as the sow/gestation crates.
attributes.additional_details: Pigs are intelligent, sentient beings and these crates deny their natural behaviours. This frustration can be displaced to damaging abnormal behaviours such as self-mutilation due to the intensive conditions. Farrowing crates severely restrict the sow's movement and deny them the instinctual urge to build a nest, worsening their frustrations. Having been made illegal in Sweden, Norway and Switzerland, we should follow this route of progression to maintain our reputation for good animal welfare.

attributes.action: Make all nightclubs and pubs charge the same price entry for men and women
attributes.background: With all the recent outrage about gender equality and the unfair treatment of women, I would like to highlight an issue which I feel should have been changed by now considering it is illegal to discriminate against someone because of gender: Nightclubs in the UK charge men more for entry.
attributes.additional_details: This is unfair and there is no logical explanation behind it.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of dogs in pet shops and introduce stricter licensing requirements.
attributes.background: Puppy farms breed masses of dogs for profit with little regard for their welfare. Many dogs in pet shops come from these puppy farms, so by banning their sale it will help drive them out of business.
attributes.additional_details: The legal limit of litters per bitch should also be lowered from six to four, to protect the health of the mother. It should be mandatory for the buyer of a puppy to first see the dog at home with its mother. This should crack down on the reselling of dogs through a third party.

attributes.action: Stop hospitals from charging blue badge holders parking in hospitals
attributes.background: As if people with disabilities don't have enough to worry about without some hospitals now charging them to park. People on disability are an easy target and often have to visit hospitals frequently through no fault of their own and to start charging them to park is a disgrace.
attributes.additional_details: We need to put an end to this and support the disabled not punish them for their disability. This can only be seen as greed and it needs to be sorted out now.

attributes.action: Make spent conviction dismissals a protected right for -2 years in employment
attributes.background: Having recently been dismissed for having a spent conviction despite the protection under the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1979. Under employment law this action is unlawful and would lead to an automatic unfair dismissal if an individual has 2 years service. This action is discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
Sec 4 of the rehabilitation of offenders act 1979 makes it unlawful to be sacked simply for not disclosing a spent conviction, yet there is no penalty or recourse for the rehabilitated person to take action against this form of discrimination!  
As this is already listed as an automatic unfair dismissal, then it should be looked at to decrease the requirement of 2 years service and treat it the same as the other protected reasons such as whistleblowing, discrimination etc.
